intro: Thlaspi californicum, commonly known as California cabbages, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other cruciferous plants. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale purple in color. Its leaves are succulent and fleshy, adapted to retain moisture in its often arid habitat. Thlaspi californicum is often found in rocky soils and is considered a characteristic species of coastal and inland scrub habitats.
